Time dilation and its effects on communication and business: If time moved at different speeds in different parts of the world, it would have significant implications for communication and business. For example, if someone in New York was traveling at the speed of light, they would experience time dilation, meaning they would return to New York faster than someone who was not traveling at that speed. This would have implications for communication, as messages sent from the fast-moving person would arrive faster than messages sent from the slower-moving person. In business, this could lead to opportunities for companies to operate in multiple time zones simultaneously, allowing them to take advantage of time dilation to gain a competitive edge.

Time dilation and its effects on international travel: If time moved at different speeds in different parts of the world, it would have significant implications for international travel. For example, if someone was traveling from New York to Tokyo, they would experience time dilation, meaning they would return to New York faster than someone who was not traveling at that speed. This would have implications for travel schedules and itineraries, as airlines and other travel companies would need to take time dilation into account when scheduling flights and other forms of transportation.
